thread.title: Ex-coach indicted for alleged sex assaults on hockey player
thread.title_full: Ex-coach indicted for alleged sex assaults on hockey player

title: Ex-coach indicted for alleged sex assaults on hockey player
text:
Former youth hockey coach indicted for alleged 1990s sexual assaults on young player 
  10/14/15 4:11 pm EDT - Updated: 10/14/15 4:11 pm EDT 
BOSTON â€” Prosecutors say a former youth hockey coach has been indicted for allegedly sexually assaulting a young player in the 1990s. 
Suffolk District Attorney Daniel Conley says 61-year-old Robert Richardson of Boston's Dorchester neighborhood has been charged with three counts of rape of a child. 
Conley says the assaults occurred starting in 1991, when the victim was 13 years old. He says the victim disclosed the attacks to investigators for the first time last year. 
Authorities say Richardson had invited the boy to spend several nights a week at his home and allegedly assaulted him there. 
A grand jury returned the indictment on Sept. 30. 
Richardson is to be arraigned Thursday in Suffolk Superior Court.
